titleStmt.title: The wandring prince and princess or, Musidorus and Anadine, both of royal prognry [sic], who being unfortunately separated by means of their parents disagreeing; as fortunately met in a desert, while they both resolved never to cease from searching, till they had found out each other. In shady deserts where was none but beasts to hear these lovers moan, there these faithful lovers met, their marriage day was quickly set. Tune, Young Phaon.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for M. Cole, T. Vere, J. Wright, J. Clark, W. Thackery, and T. Passenger,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the British Library.
